title: RUN: Relative path annotation important for running local commands is stripped from inputs
body:
```shell

╭─adina@odin ~/Repos/BIDSsacc on master
╰─➤ datalad run --input ./generate_simg.sh '{inputs}'                                                                                                                                                        127 ↵
[INFO   ] Making sure inputs are available (this may take some time) 
[INFO   ] == Command start (output follows) ===== 
/bin/sh: 1: generate_simg.sh: not found
[INFO   ] == Command exit (modification check follows) ===== 
[INFO   ] The command had a non-zero exit code. If this is expected, you can save the changes with 'datalad save -r -F .git/COMMIT_EDITMSG .' 
CommandError: command 'generate_simg.sh' failed with exitcode 127
Failed to run 'generate_simg.sh' under '/home/adina/Repos/BIDSsacc'. Exit code=127.

```
a possible workaround is

```shell 
╭─adina@odin ~/Repos/BIDSsacc on master
╰─➤ datalad run --input ./generate_simg.sh './{inputs}'
[INFO   ] Making sure inputs are available (this may take some time) 
[INFO   ] == Command start (output follows) ===== 
[INFO   ] == Command exit (modification check follows) ===== 
add(ok): envs/Singularity.1.1 (file)
save(ok): /home/adina/Repos/BIDSsacc (dataset)
action summary:
  add (ok: 1)
  get (notneeded: 1)
  save (ok: 1)
```
but ideally that shouldn't be necessary.
